es.ucm.fdi.lps.p4.command
Class DropCommand

java.lang.Object
  es.ucm.fdi.lps.p4.command.Command
      es.ucm.fdi.lps.p4.command.DropCommand
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable
public class DropCommand
extends Command

Represents a Drop command from the player that moves an item from the player inventory to the player location.

  • It uses a command-specific property called "keyword.dropCommand" which default value is "drop".
  • It uses a command-specific property called "keyword.dropCommand.abbrev" which default value is "d".
  • It uses a command-specific property called "keyword.dropCommand.alt" which default value is "unpick".
  • It uses a command-specific property called "message.dropCommand.help" which default value is "(drop|d|unpick) ".
  • It uses a command-specific property called "message.dropCommand.itemNameNotInInventory" which default value is "There is no item with that name in the inventory.".
  • It uses a command-specific property called "message.dropCommand.itemNameRepeatedInInventory" which default value is "There are several items with that name in the inventory.".
  • It uses a command-specific property called "message.dropCommand.itemNameAlreadyInLocation" which default value is "There is another item with that name in this location.".
  • It uses a command-specific property called "message.dropCommand.success" which default value is "It has been dropped.".
  • It uses a command-specific property called "message.dropCommand.failure" which default value is "That item cannot be dropped in this location.".
  • It uses a command-specific property called "message.dropCommand.undoSuccess" which default value is "It has returned to the inventory.".
  • It uses a command-specific property called "message.dropCommand.undoFailure" which default value is "The item cannot return to the inventory from this location.".
  • It uses a command-specific property called "flag.dropCommand.allowFIFODisambiguationForItemNameRepeatedInInventory" which default value is "false".
  • It uses a command-specific property called "flag.dropCommand.allowRepetitionsInLocationItemNames" which default value is "false".

Constructor Detail

DropCommand

public DropCommand(Game game)
Constructs a Drop command (as an specific type of Command) that has access to a given game. Initially the command is unparsed and unexecuted. Default configuration is assumed at this moment.

Parameters:
game - The game.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The argument 'game' cannot be null.

DropCommand

public DropCommand(Game game,
                   java.util.Properties config)
Constructs a Drop command (as an specific type of Command) that has access to a given game. Initially the command is unparsed and unexecuted. The properties defined in the given configuration override those of the default configuration.

Parameters:
game - The game.
config - The configuration.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The arguments 'game' and 'config' cannot be null.
Method Detail

setConfiguration

Parses the configuration from the configuration file

setDefaultConfiguration

private void setDefaultConfiguration()
Sets the default configuration

execute

public boolean execute()
Executes the Drop command, moving the item from the player inventory to the player location, if it is possible. When the item name is repeated in the player inventory, this command may fail or allow a FIFO disambiguation (chosing the first item with that name that was added to the inventory), depending on the configuration. When there is already an item with that name in the location, this command may fail or succeed (dropping the item anyway), depending on the configuration.

Overrides:
execute in class Command
Returns:
true if the command has been correctly executed; false otherwise.
See Also:
Command.execute()

public java.lang.String getHelp()
Gets the help information about this Drop command: drop .

getHelp in class Command
Returns:
The help information.
See Also:
Command.getHelp()

parse

public boolean parse(java.lang.String line)
Parses a text line trying to identify a player invocation to this Drop command (e.g. "drop sword").

Specified by:
parse in class Command
Parameters:
line - The text line.
Returns:
true if the text line has been correctly parsed and the command correctly configured; false otherwise.
See Also:
Command.parse(String)

undo

public boolean undo()
Undoes the Drop command execution, moving the item back from the player location to the player inventory, if it is possible.

Overrides:
undo in class Command
Returns:
true if the command has been correctly undone; false otherwise.
See Also:
Command.undo()

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Returns a String representation for this object: DropCommand[item name]. This is useful for debugging purposes.

Specified by:
toString in class Command
